sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for measuring the absorbance of colored solutions.
sections.scope: Applicable to analytical tasks in Pharmaceutical Analysis.
procedure: Switch ON the colorimeter and allow it to warm up for 15 minutes.
Select the appropriate filter or wavelength for the sample being analyzed.
Fill a clean cuvette with the blank (solvent) and wipe the sides with a lint-free tissue.
Insert the blank into the sample holder and set the instrument to zero absorbance.
Replace the blank with the sample solution in a similar cuvette.
Record the absorbance or transmittance value from the display.
Repeat the measurement for standards to create a calibration curve.
Clean the cuvettes and the sample compartment after use.
Switch OFF the instrument at the end of the day.
precautions: Always handle cuvettes by the frosted sides to avoid fingerprints.
Ensure there are no air bubbles in the sample solution.
Use matched cuvettes for more accurate results.
Maintain a consistent orientation of the cuvette in the holder.
Protect the instrument from dust and chemical vapors.
